meta.name: left-pad
meta.narrative: left-pad was a trivial 11-line npm package for left-padding strings. In March 2016, its author Azer Koculu unpublished it from npm after a trademark dispute with Kik messenger. The removal broke thousands of builds including React, Babel, and many other major projects. This exposed npm's fragile dependency model. The package had a single maintainer and was a tiny utility with no meaningful development activity.

expected.notes: Single maintainer, tiny package with no recent development. Moderate downloads from transitive dependency chains. All maintainer health indicators were poor. Evolution score is moderate because last release was only ~54 days before evaluation.
